+category
revision.text:
===THE PURPOSE OF LAYING ON HANDS === The laying on of hands has many functions, not least important, that of ministering blessing, peace and comfort to others. It is a foundation stone of Yahweh's House in that many ministries are dependent upon it. The following are some of the main usages of it --
1. To minister healing 2. For the ministration of signs and wonders 3. For the impartation of the Baptism of the Spirit 4. To impart spiritual gifts
1. TO MINISTER HEALING The practice of laying on hands was very prominent in the old covenant for healing and it's use was continued in the new order. Naaman expected this in his healing from leprosy 2 Kings 5:11 Y'shua practiced it in His ministry - "all they that had any sick with various diseases brought them unto Him; and He laid hands on every one of them, and healed them." Luke 4:40 Also in Matthew 8:3; 9:18; 20:34 Mark 1:41; 5:23; 6: 5; 7:32; 8:23,24
He said that other believers would also do this. "They shall lay hands on the sick and they shall recover" Mark 16:18 The apostles and other disciples followed this example "And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and dysentry: Paul went in unto him and prayed, and he laid his hands on him and healed him." Acts 28: 8
2. TO MINISTER SIGNS AND WONDERS "And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people" Acts 5:12
"Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who was bearing witness to the word of His grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands." Acts 14: 3
"Now God worked unusual miracles by the hands of Paul" Acts 19:11
3. TO MINISTER THE BAPTISM OF THE HOLY SPIRIT The baptism of the Holy Spirit operated through Baptism in water upon repentance, but on some occasions in the establishment of the early Assembly, it was imparted through the laying on of hands.
These occasions were - i. To Paul after his conversion on the Damascus road, Ananias came and prayed for healing and for him to receive the Holy Spirit. Acts 9:17
ii. Paul to Timothy “Therefore I remind you to stir up the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands." 2 Timothy 1:6
iii. To the Samaritans in Acts 8 who had already believed through Phillip's preaching and ministry of the gifts of the Spirit. The eldership of the Jerusalem council came down to establish and authorise their entrance into the kingdom (Acts 8:18) - Simon saw that through the laying on of hands the Holy Spirit was given.
iv. To the Ephesians who had already been baptised unto John's baptism, Paul therefore laid hands on them to complete their spiritual experience. Acts 19:11
4. TO IMPART SPIRITUAL GIFTS "For I long to see you, that I may impart some spiritual gift, so that you may be established" Romans 1:11 It was the established practice to "impart spiritual gifts" by the laying on of hands and the accompanying prophetic word.
Timothy is one example that is recorded who received his gifting by the laying on of hands and prophecy of the eldership, most probably that of Ephesus. "stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands" 2 Timothy 1: 6 This word 'through' or 'by' conveys the idea of being a channel in the Greek language.
In the Syriac Peshitta which antedates the oldest copies which we have of the new covenant scriptures, and which is the sister dialect of the Aramaic language spoken by the disciples, the particular preposition (through) was a compound form literally meaning "with the hand of". All through the Syriac Peshitta, this word is used in the idea of a channel of impartation. (This was the version used by the early assemblies). This concept of the hand being a channel of impartation was so strong that it affected the language of that era.
The gifts were imparted together with the ministry of prophecy, as Paul refers to in 1 Timothy 4:14 "by prophecy, with the laying on of hands" The word 'with' here is 'meta' in Greek and conveys the idea of association between prophecy and the laying on of hands. One was in conjunction with the other. Thus the gift was imparted through the both avenues of ministry.
===QUALIFICATIONS FOR IMPARTARTION OF GIFTS=== The ministration of laying on of hands is for every believer - "These signs shall follow them that believe .. .. they shall lay hands on the sick .. " Mark 16:17-18
All believes are called to be priests and exercise their priestly ministry to Yahweh but there are requirements for them to be able to minister in the Spirit. They need to be --
1. Set Apart Being a kingdom of priests in the new covenant, we exercise all the privileges of the priests of the old order.
In the Levitical system, the priests exercised this ministry in the sacrificial system firstly by being consecrated and then they operated in their ministry provided they were in a state of ceremonial cleanliness. If they were defiled, they were not to minister. (Exodus 29:10; Leviticus 16:21; 1: 4; 3:2; - Numbers 19:20-22)
This same principle applies for us, we are to consecrated to His service, so that in our worship of Him and ministry to the people, we will be able to "lift up holy hands without wrath and doubting" 1 Timothy 2: 8 We are to be a holy priesthood, set apart for His service - 1 Peter 2: 5, 9-12
"But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay, some for honour and some for dishonour. Therefore if anyone cleanse himself from the latter, he will be vessel for honour, sanctified and useful for the Master, prepared for every good work." 2 Timothy 2:20-21
2. Spirit-filled Y'shua said, "He who believes in Me, as the scripture has said, out of his heart shall flow rivers of living water. But this He spoke concerning the Spirit, whom those believing in Him would receive, .. .. " John 7:38,39
"understand what the will of the Lord is. .. .. be filled with the Spirit" Ephesians 5:18, 19
To impart from the Spirit, you must be abiding in the Vine so that the sap of that vine is flowing through you. If you, as the branch are withered, the flow of the life is also dried up. You need to be in right relationship and be full of the blessing of Yahweh, to have an abundance to give out to others. Your vessel needs to be kept full to overflowing, to allow the rivers of living water to flow through in ministration to others. John 15: 1-8
3. Filled with Faith in the Word "Let the word of Messiah dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalm and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your heart to Yahweh. And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Y'shua, giving thanks to God the Father through Him." Colossians 3:16-17
Our life needs to be centered in the Word, so that everything we do is Word-based and Word-filled.
If all of our thinking and motivation is based on the Word, we will be prepared for the situations that come and have the necessary faith to minister in His Name.
"So faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God." Romans 10:17
"If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire and it will be done for you. By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so will you be My disciples" John 15: 7, 8
4. Be Anointed Anointing for a specific task depends on one's own anointing and spiritual status. The anointing on our lives can be increased by prayer, fasting and waiting upon Yahweh.
All believers may lay hands on one another and pray for various needs to be met, but there is always a greater deposit of the anointing in areas where one has personally overcome or been ministered to. Greater authority is exercised over the works of darkness through personal victory. Y'shua is an example of this, He healed all who were oppressed by the devil (Acts 10:38). Our anointing may be limited in its effectiveness.
===FUNCTION OF THE ELDERSHIP=== Giftings for ministry within the Body are imparted by the anointed eldership of apostles and prophets. It is a transference of the anointing that rests on one to another, as with Paul to Timothy, according to the measure of growth of the developing ministry and at the direction of the Holy Spirit. For instance, Paul exhorted Timothy to do the work of an evangelist, but he was in training by Yahweh to fill a pastoral role (2 Timothy 4: 5).
See also Numbers 27:18-23 where Moses lays hands on Joshua for his ordination, and, "Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands on him: " Deuteronomy 34: 9
The ministry of the presbytery via the laying on of hands and the prophetic word, establishes ministries in a local body in their area of function and gives the needed validation to those ministries, thus bringing order. It assists the individual members to know their place in the Body, giving confirmation of their function and direction for further development, as they heed the prophetic word given through the eldership.
"When He ascended on high, He led captivity captive and gave gifts to men," .. .. for the equipping of the saints for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Messiah" Ephesians 4: 8, 12
When Y'shua triumphed over the enemy, He led his hosts captive and gained back from him the original divine mandate which was given to Adam of priestly dominion (Colossians 2:15). The governmental positions which Satan usurped are now dispensed to His Body through the appointed offices of leadership which He has ordained as gifts for the edification and growth of His Body to it's full maturity wherein it can assume it's calling to rule and to reign with Him. Revelation 5: 8-10
Therefore it is one of the foundation stones of the House of Yahweh after Baptisms, in the ongoing process of establishing the believer in particular, and the Body as a whole.
"Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God, having been built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Y'shua the Messiah being the chief cornerstone, in whom the whole building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord, in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God in the Spirit." Ephesians 2:19-22
Thus this ministry of the laying on of hands is foundational in the growth of the Body, as it is through this ordinance that the ministries established by Messiah, that of the Apostle and Prophet in particular, impart the necessary grace for the edification of the rest of the Body to come to its fulfillment in Messiah. Ephesians 4: 7-16
"If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of Yahweh. If anyone ministers, let him do it with the ability which Yahweh supplies, that in all things God may be glorified through Y'shua the Messiah" 1 Peter 4:11
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: /* RESURRECTION */
revision.text:
===RESURRECTION=== Resurrection means a 'raising up', or 'rising up' from the Greek word ANASTASIS. In the verb form it means 'to cause to stand or rise up; to raise from sleep or from the dead'. The word 'rapture' is a term not found in scripture and represents an erroneous doctrine. Rapture comes from the word Raptus which is found in the Latin Vulgate and it is the Latin form of the Greek word Harpazo which means "caught up" 1 Thessalonians 4:16-18 is the doctrine of the Rapture
===THE BASIS OF SALVATION=== The resurrection of the dead is one of the most basic of doctrines; and we accept it as fact that Y'shua the Messiah not only suffered and died for the sins of the world, but that He subsequently rose from the grave by the power of the Almighty God - His Father.
"Messiah died for our sins .. .. and that He was buried and rose again on the third day .. .. He was seen of Peter, then by the twelve. After that He was seen by over five hundred brethren at once," 1 Corinthians 15: 3-7
It is the foundation of our faith, for, "If Messiah is not risen, then our preaching is empty and your faith is also empty. .. ..you are still in your sins!" (1 Corinthians 15:14 and 17b) The basis of the 'good news' and our salvation rests in His resurrection. For the reality of the resurrection means that Y'shua Messiah not only rose from the dead, but that He is alive today.
Y'shua's resurrection is also Yahweh's infallible guarantee that all who genuinely believe in His Son will likewise rise from their graves and live forever, even though the sleep of temporal death may overtake them.
This is the 'gospel' - the good news of salvation, not only salvation from the power of sin, but also from all its consequences, the ultimate outworking being death not only in its spiritual form, but also from the ultimate state of physical death.
===RESURRECTION FROM DEATH=== Death is not a state of non-existence, nor is it annihilation, but in its scriptural sense it is a separation from the Source of life. Our present existence is actually a state of death. See Luke 16:19-31; Isaiah 14:9-11; 1 Peter 3:18-20 Death affects man in three levels. 1. Spiritually 2. Physically 3. Eternally - 'to the ages of the ages'
1. Spiritual Death This is the separation of the soul of man from God through sin. Adam as a living soul died spiritually in the literal day that he sinned. He became severed from the life that is in Yahweh God. "the soul who sins will die" (Ezekiel 18:20)
"The wages of sin is death" (Romans 6:23) - death (separation from the true and living God) is the repayment you receive from being your own 'god'.
"To be carnally minded is death, but to be spiritually minded is life and peace" (Romans 8: 6). 'Carnal' as used here is 'fleshly' - i.e. thinking according to the flesh, or allowing the flesh to dominate your life. That brings death (James 1:12-15). So although physically alive, you can be spiritually 'dead'. 1 Timothy 5: 6; Revelation 3: 1
2. Physical Death Physical death is the separation of the soul and spirit from the body. Man was not meant to die, Adam died physically 930 years after he sinned, which was in the typical 'day' that Yahweh predicted (2 Peter 3:8). See Romans 5:12,14,21 and Hebrews 9:27
Our bodies were formed to regenerate - the cells renew themselves and medical science cannot determine why man dies. It is the principle of sin outworking in our bodies, in death as a process - "dying you shall die". Weakness, sickness and disease.
3. Eternal Death This is the judgment determined on all those who reject the atonement for sin purchased by the Saviour. It is called in scripture, the 'second death' which is effected through the 'lake of fire'. Revelation 20:11-15 Of this all the prophets warned "to flee from the wrath to come" where He will "burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire" (Matthew 3: 7, 12) This is the 'worm' that never dies and the fire that is not quenched - Isaiah 66:24; Mark 9:43-48
Those who overcome the 'flesh' are assured that they will not be hurt by the 'second death'. Revelation 2:11; 20:6
But, “…the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death." Revelation 21:8
Y'shua, the second man, the substitute Adam tasted death in every form for man. As the 'last Adam', He overcame death on our behalf. He tasted death spiritually in His separation from the Father, physically by being put to death in the flesh, and when He went into Sheol/Hades, He experienced eternal death on our behalf. (Hebrews 2:9; 1 Corinthians 15:45-47)
Because of His sinlessness, death could not hold him in its clutches, when the sentence was completed that He took on our behalf, the Spirit of Yahweh raised Him from the grave triumphant over all the powers of darkness that had sought to hold Him in their grip. Read Psalm 22: 6-8,14-18 of the Saviour's suffering.
He arose!
He arose the victor, triumphant over death and now as a life-giving Spirit He imparts His victorious life to us.
===THE PROCESS OF RESURRECTION=== Through Messiah, man is made alive, 'raised up' to spiritual life and immortality through the gospel (2 Timothy 1:9-10). He died to redeem us spiritually, physically and eternally and to deliver us from he who has the power of death, that is, Satan. "That through death (Messiah's), He might destroy him that has the power of death, that is, the devil" Hebrews 2:14,15
1. Spiritual Resurrection From being in a state of death, man is 'raised up' to live in the spiritual realms by the Ruach HaKodesh. This is the process of being 'born again' or 'born from above' - spiritually regenerated (John 3: 3-5). This is a resurrection.
From being dead in trespasses and sins, man is made alive together with Messiah, and He has "raised us up together, and made us sit together in the heavenly places (spiritual realms) in Messiah Y'shua" (Ephesians 2: 1,5-6 & Colossians 2:12-13)
"For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death, certainly we shall also be in the likeness of His resurrection." Romans 6: 5
"But if the Spirit who raised up Messiah from the dead dwell in you, He who raised up Messiah from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through His Spirit who dwells in you." Romans 8:11 Health and healing are also the outworking of His Spirit in us. See also 2 Corinthians 4:10,11
Man is a tri-partite being, spirit soul and body (1 Thessalonians 5:23). There is a process of resurrection that needs to take place in our souls, as well as our spirit and then finally with our bodies. The redemptive work for our soul was completed at Calvary, but we need to appropriate that work into our life.
We have been chosen to salvation through sanctification (holiness) by the Spirit and belief in the truth. (2 Thessalonians 2:13)
We are to work out our own salvation with fear and trembling (Philippians 2:12), "Receiving (ensuring) the end of your faith, the salvation of your souls." 1 Peter 1: 9
As Paul prayed, that "Your whole spirit, soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Y'shua the Messiah" 1 Thessalonians 5:23
2. Physical Resurrection The promise of the resurrection of our physical bodies is the glorious hope of the gospel.
The scriptures declare that the resurrection of the believers body will be like unto Messiah's glorious body after His resurrection, --- "Who will transform our lowly body that it may be conformed to His glorious body, according to the working whereby He is able even to subdue all things unto Himself." Philippians 3:21
"we shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed. For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass that saying that is written, 'Death is swallowed up in victory'" 1 Cor.15:52-4
Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom, we must be changed. We shall no longer have flesh and blood bodies, but as His was when He arose, a flesh and bone body. 1 Corinthians 15:47-49 & Luke 24:39
In that flesh and bone body, Y'shua ate and drank and conducted himself in life for those 40 days, but was obviously not bound by the laws of the physical realm. He was a spirit-man in a 'glorious body' incorruptible physical body.
"As we have borne the image of the earthy, so we shall also bear the image of the heavenly (or spiritual) " 1 Corinthians 15:49
This was the same hope of the Old covenant saints -
"Your dead shall live; together with my dead body they shall arise." Isaiah 26:19
"In my flesh I shall see God" Job 19:26
"I will ransom them from the power of the grave. I will redeem them from death." Hosea 13:14
"I will see Your face in righteousness, I shall be satisfied when I awake in your likeness" Psalm 17:15 (David)
===TWO RESURRECTIONS=== "There will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and the unjust" Acts 24:15
"The hour is coming, in which all that are in the graves shall hear His voice, and shall come forth, they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life, and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of judgment." John 5:28,29
'''First Resurrection''' This is a resurrection to life in the flesh for all those who have died in Messiah and have no need of judgment in their lives. They will live with Him during the Messianic age on earth as a firstfruits of His creation that come to perfection.
"we also who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, eagerly awaiting the adoption, the redemption of our body. For we were saved in this hope .. .. .." "Likewise the Spirit helps us in our infirmities .. .. .. because He makes intercession for the saints according to the will of Yahweh. .. .. "For whom He foreknew, He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son, that He might be the firstborn among many brethren." Romans 8:23,26a,27b,29
The redemption of our bodies is dependent upon us being conformed to His image by the working of His Spirit in our lives. From the initial deposit of the Spirit in our lives (the 'firsfruits') to the outworking of His image in us, we are called to be holy. The operation of His Spirit is to produce a Bride without spot or wrinkle. Ephesians 5:25
This is what He is coming for! "Blessed and holy is he who has part in the first resurrection." Revelation 20: 6; 19:7-9
'''Second Resurrection''' This is a resurrection to judgment. Sometimes called the Great White Throne judgment. The books are opened and all who are raised in this resurrection are judged according to their works. Revelation 20:12,13
The book of Life is also opened and whoever is not found written in this book is cast into the Lake of Fire. Revelation 20:15 Death and the place of the dead, Sheol/Hades are cast into the Lake of Fire. Death is abolished and the grave emptied.
Y'shua gave many parables regarding unfaithfulness and its rewards. Faithful and wise stewards of our Masters goods will receive dominion to rule and reign with Him (i.e. the first resurrection), but the unwise shall receive their portion with the unbelievers, which means they will be raised in the second resurrection to judgment. Luke 12:35-50
"The Lord knows how to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the day of judgment." 2 Peter 2: 9
The unprofitable servant who knew His master's will and didn't do it, is cast into outer darkness where there will be weeping and wailing and gnashing of teeth. Matthew 25:30; 8:11,12
"Therefore, brethren, be even more diligent to make your call and election sure, for if you do these things you will never stumble; for so an entrance will be supplied to you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our King and Savior Messiah Y'shua." 2 Peter 1:2-11
SUMMARY 1. Y'shua was raised to life by the power of Yahweh God. (Acts 4:10, Romans 6:4)
2. He was subsequently seen by over 500 witnesses. (Acts 2:32, 1 Corinthains 15:6)
3. The Bible clearly teaches the resurrection of the dead as a foundational teaching . (1 Corinthians 15:20-23)
4. There are two general resurrections: The first, the Resurrection to Life, will take place at the return of Messiah. (1 Thessalonians 4:16-17, John 5:29)
The second, the Resurrection to Judgment, will occur a thousand years after the first resurrection. (Revelation 20: 5-6)
5. Resurrected believers who rise at the first resurrection will come forth with glorified and immortal bodies, similar to the body Y'shua possessed when He rose from the grave. (1 Corinthians 15:42-44, 1 John 3:2)
6. They will then receive their awards and eternal inheritance. (Luke 14:14; Matthew 16:27)
7. The unbeliever and the unfaithful will rise in the Resurrection of Judgement at the end of the millennium. (Rev. 20:12-14)
8. All those who seek to live forever should accept and act upon the words of the Saviour who said: "I am the resurrection, and the life: He that believes in me, though he may die, yet shall he live." John 11:25
"Therefore, beloved, looking forward to these things, be diligent to be found by Him in peace, without spot and blameless;" 2 Peter 3:14
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: +category
revision.text:
===ORDER OF THE RESURRECTION=== At the second advent of Messiah, those who have died in Messiah, the saints of all ages, will be raised to life and then those who are alive will be changed from their state of mortality to immortality to join those who have been raised from the dead. This resurrection will be a raising of the physical body to be immortal and incorruptible.
"But I do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who have fallen asleep, .. .. For if we believe that Y'shua died and rose again, even so Yahweh will bring with Him those who sleep in Y'shua. For this we say to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will by no means precede those who are asleep. For the Lord will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of God . And the dead in Messiah shall be raised first." 1 Thessalonians 4:13-16
Those who have fallen asleep in Messiah, the saints of past ages and those in this age, will be raised first. Note. They looked forward in faith to Messiah's coming, we look back to His appearance in the flesh.
"Behold I tell you a mystery: we shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed - in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed. For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality, " 1 Corinthians 15:51-53
"Then we who are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And thus we shall always be with the Lord" 1 Thessalonians 4:17
".. .. we also eagerly await the Savior, the Lord, Y'shua the Messiah, who will transform our lowly body that it may be conformed to His glorious body, according to the working whereby He is able to subdue all things to Himself." Phil.3:20b-21
We who are alive and remain until the time of His coming will be caught up in the air with the returning saints and be changed from mortality to immortality, from corruptible flesh to incorruptible one which will be like Y'shua's resurrection body.
===THE TRUMPET CALL=== '''The timing''' "Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory. And He will send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other." Matthew 24:30-31
Yahweh will sound the trumpet to gather His elect. See also 1 Corinthians 15:51 "at the last trumpet", and 1 Thessalonians 4:16 "with the voice of the archangel, and with the trumpet of God"
This is the trumpet call for the saints of the first resurrection, and take note, by Y'shua's words it is "after the tribulation of those days" in verse 29 of Matthew 24. The sun being darkened and the moon not giving its light and the powers of heaven being shaken all precede His coming. "For then there will be great tribulation, such as has not been since the beginning of the world until this time, no, nor ever shall be. And unless those days were shortened, no flesh would be saved; But for the elect's sake those days will be shortened." Matthew 24:21,22
'''The Season of His Return''' Y'shua said that no man would know the day or the hour of His return, (Matthew 24:36; 25:13) but it would appear that we can know the season of His return as is illustrated by the parable of the fig tree. (Matthew 24:32-35; Luke 21:29-31)
"But take heed to yourselves. lest your hearts be weighed down with carousing, drunkenness and the cares of this life, and that day come upon you unexpectedly. For it will come as a snare on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth. Watch therefore, and pray always that you may be counted worthy to escape (Lit. 'flee out') all these things that will come to pass, and to stand before the Son of Man." Luke 21:34-36
"Now brethren, concerning the coming of our Lord Y'shua the Messiah and our gathering together to Him, .. .. that day will not come unless the falling away comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of perdition, .. 2 Thessalonians 2: 1-3
Y'shua warns of falling away, of being caught up in the lifestyle of the world (See also Matthew 24:37-39), as does Paul. After the falling away begins, then the man of sin, the AntiChrist/AntiMessiah will be revealed. Paul is correcting false ideas in Thessalonica that the resurrection may have been past (2:2), and showing them that it could not be so, for although there had been many of that type of spirit, the 'lawless one' (the AntiChrist/Messiah) had not arrived on the scene. Furthermore, Paul says in 2 Thessalonians 2:8 that he would be destroyed at Messiah's coming. This gives assurance for all time that there will be no secret coming (see also Matthew 24:26,27) as the Rapture doctrine teaches.
It also is a time indicator, as the prophetic time spans in Revelation of 1,260 days indicate the length of AntiMessiah's rule. But we have another clear indicator. Y'shua's return will be at the last trumpet.
Each prophetic event so far has sequenced with the feast of its kind. Messiah's sacrifice was on Passover, the giving of the Spirit on Shavuot/Pentecost, perfectly fulfilling the type.His second coming will also fulfill the type of the feast of Trumpets, in the last segment of Feasts of the prophetic year.
So, we know the season of the year, and, we are told, "But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, you have no need that I should write to you .." But you, brethren, are not in darkness, so that this Day should overtake you as a thief. You are all sons of light and sons of the day. We are not of the night, nor of darkness" 1 Thessalonians 5: 1,4,5
This Day will overtake the world and those of the kingdom who are not walking in the light (see verses 6-10) as a thief in the night, but those of us who are of the 'day' will understand the times and the seasons, and the scriptural interpretation of them. We will see clearly.
===THE FINAL ACT OF REDEMPTION=== Resurrection of the body is the final stage of our redemption. Romans 8:23 The first two stages of redemption need to be complete for the redemption of the body to be effected. That is, the redemption of the spirit in conversion is the first step. But also then, the second part of our 'salvation' is in the renewing of the soul, our mind/personality (Romans 12:1-2; Colossians 3: 1-10). We are predestined to be conformed to His image (Romans 8:29).
We have the Spirit as a guarantee (a deposit, a down payment) of our coming inheritance, but the progressive installments must be made on any goods purchased with a down payment, to be able to take final possession of the article. Those progressive payments are made as we allow the Spirit to work out His purposes in our lives to appropriate what was purchased for us at Calvary. We need to become filled with all the fullness of Yahweh. 2 Corinthians 5:1-11; Ephesians 3:19-21
"Be diligent that you may be found in Him in peace (not with rebuke), without spot and blameless" 2 Peter 3:14
"Even as the testimony of Messiah was confirmed in you, so that you come short in no gift, eagerly waiting for the revelation of our Lord, Y'shua the Messiah, who will confirm you to the end that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Y'shua the Messiah." 1 Corinthians 1: 6-8
Our perfection/holiness and coming to full stature as a son of the Almighty is what He died for! (Eph.4: 7,12-13; Heb. 2:10)
"Messiah loved the Church/Assembly and gave Himself for her, that he might sanctify and cleanse her .. that He might present her to Himself a glorious church/assembly, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she should be holy and without blemish." Ephesians 5:25b-27
He is coming for a pure and spotless Bride!
"not having spot or wrinkle" The 'spots' are the stains of sin on our garments which have not been cleansed by the blood of the Lamb, and the 'wrinkles' are the evidences of the old nature creasing our garments, the imperfections and limitations of the fallen human nature.
Messiah's life needs to be completely worked out in us so that our righteousness is 'bright and clean'. The parable of the ten virgins tells the story of those who were not ready. No time to prepare when you realise that His return is imminent and that you lack the measure of the anointing to bring you to His perfection. Matthew 25:1-13
===THE ELECT COMPANY=== John was given the vision of the elect company of the last days and it includes two groups:
1. Overcomers - Israelites, the select 144,000 Revelation 7: 1- 8 2. Great Multitude - ::all nations, tribes, peoples, and tongues, out of great tribulation Revelation 7: 9-17 ::priests of God to rule and reign with Him 1,000 years Revelation 20: 4-6
'''The Overcomers''' This group is pictured in Revelation 7 and again in Revelation 14. They were sealed with the seal of Yahweh in Chapter 7 for protection from the judgments to come on the earth. These are those who have come into their full inheritance to rule with Messiah in His governmental system. They have followed the Lamb completely, not being defiled with false religious systems ('women'), and are without fault before the throne of God. They are His firstfruits company who are worthy to have their Father's name written in their forehead, having taken on their full Israelite identity and function as a kingdom of priests. Revelation 14:1-5
'''The Bride''' The 'Bride' includes all those from ages past until the present who have walked 'in white' with Him and became worthy to be called to the marriage supper of the Lamb.
"Let us be glad and rejoice, and give Him glory, for the marriage of the Lamb has come, and His wife has made herself ready. And to her it was granted to be arrayed in fine linen, clean and bright, for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints. Blessed are those who are called to the marriage supper of the Lamb." Revelation 19:7-9
'Blessed and holy is he who has a part in the First Resurrection" - Revelation 20:4-5
===ATTAINING A BETTER RESURRECTION=== Paul spoke of a "better resurrection" in Hebrews 11:35 'Better' is from the Greek word KREISSN 1 - stronger or more powerful. Vine's Expository Dictionary says that in this instance it gives the sense of more useful or more excellent. A stronger, more powerful, more excellent resurrection.
Paul speaking of his own aspirations says, "That I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death, if by any means, I may attain to the resurrection of the dead." Philippians 3:10-11
Was Paul doubting his spiritual standing? or was there some other meaning to what he was saying?
The literal translation of the last phase is "if somehow I may attain to the resurrection out of the dead."
Next he goes on to say, "Not that I already received, or already been perfected" (Interlinear Literal Translation v.12)
So this is a question of having received a status of perfection to qualify for this superior quality resurrection. For which he says, "I press toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Y'shua the Messiah." (Ch.3:14)
Paul outlines this standard of perfection in Ephesians 4:13 "to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Messiah;"
The letters to the assemblies of Colossae, Ephesus and Phillipi were written from Rome during his term of imprisonment. Paul is coming to the end of his spiritual journey. He obviously realises that he is not going to be alive for His return, which the early church thought would be imminent, and he is aspiring to a superior resurrection, to be one of those who were walking by the Spirit, crucifying the flesh and 'striving' to attain the perfection that is in Y'shua. Philippians 3:15-21; Galatians 2:20
Paul had his sight set on attaining the first resurrection from out of the state of death which was for those first attaining the sonship for which Messiah died, the firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.
Our Father subjected the whole creation to futility in the hope of receiving His inheritance in His sons, and the whole creation groans and travails awaiting its deliverance from the corruption resulting from the fall, in order to come into this coming glorious liberty (or liberation) of the sons of God. The creation itself is groaning for the realisation of this, and all of Yahweh's future plans await the manifestation of our sonship in the earth. Romans 8:20-21
So be encouraged to press toward the mark for the high calling of Yahweh in Y'shua the Messiah.
"The sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us." Romans 8:18
"Therefore be patient, brethren, until the coming of our Lord. See how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, waiting patiently for it until it receives the early and the latter rain. You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is at hand." James 5: 7-8
"Beloved, now are we the children of God; and it has not yet been revealed what we shall be, but we know that when He is revealed, we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is. And everyone who has this hope purifies himself, just as He is pure." 1 John 3:2-3
"He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be His God and He shall be My son." Revelation 21: 7
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: +category
revision.text:
===A RESURRECTION TO PHYSICAL LIFE=== Resurrection is a bringing to life of the physical body out of the state of death, reconstituting the original physical form.
Yeshua said: "Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the DEAD shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live. . . Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice, and shall come forth; they that have done good, to the resurrection of life. And they that have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment" John 5:25-29.
This resurrection will include all from Adam until that time, the innumerable billions who have lived and died on this earth, who did not qualify to be in the First Resurrection and to be part of the "firstfruits" company of Yahweh's Bride. They will be raised to physical human life to be judged for the things done in the body.
"It is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment" Hebrews 9:27
===RESURRECTION TO LIFE TO ENACT JUDGMENT=== This resurrection is a resurrection to judgment of good and evil actions, and those who have done 'evil' will be judged. There is no categorising of the type of evil or of the degree, it includes all those who are not completely holy. That is, all that is not up to the standard of Yahweh's holiness. 'Evil' is the outworking of the sinful nature whose motivation is from self, and not necessarily that which is apparently evil to man. That which can appear good and righteous in the sight of man, is as filthy rags in the sight of Almighty God if it originates out of the self nature for it's own sense of self-worth. "There is a way which seems right to a man, but it's end is the way of death." Proverbs 14:12
The second resurrection is a resurrection to JUDGMENT! Those coming up in this resurrection will be judged "according to their works"!
John writes of this resurrection: "And I saw the dead [all who ever lived], small and great, stand before God; and the BOOKS were opened [containing the record of their deeds and misdeeds, both good and bad]: and another book was opened, which is the BOOK OF LIFE: and the dead were JUDGED out of those things written in the books, according to their WORKS" Revelation 20:12
The word for judgment here (kriseõs) (rendered 'damnation' in the KJV) but it has the meaning of making a selection, to determine, to form an opinion and to undergo a process of trial (Vine's Expository Dictionary). The sense is that of correction stemming from opinions or decisions given, concerning the relevant actions. In other words, this judgment is a critique of things done, which then brings down a sentence.
The sentence or judgment will be according to the acts of the person and will not necessarily result in complete condemnation for every person, but there will be those who warrant the judgment of 'hell fire'. It will be a process of judgment that will decide each person's eternal destiny.
===THOSE INCLUDED IN THIS RESURRECTION=== Those in this general resurrection will include many categories of people.
1. All unsaved people who never had the opportunity for salvation -- those who grew up, lived and died in a society which didn't have the knowledge of Yahweh, or His truth. Those who lived and died in ignorance, some in total darkness who never even heard the true Gospel of the Messiah during their lives! At that future time they will be "judged" according to their works. Romans 2:12-13
2. Many who have come to faith, but have either been under the old covenant, or else had not understood the new covenant, and did not enter into a spiritual 'born again' experience, they will be raised at this time.
3. Those who came to faith in Messiah, but who have areas in their lives that will incur judgment and/or were not diligent in serving Him , will in fact be consigned to the second resurrection . 1 Peter 4: 3-5; Matthew 25:30
4. This will also include those who were deceived by false religions that blinded them to the truth.
5. Many of the 'sons of the kingdom' of the House of Judah incurred the punishment inflicted because of their rejection of Messiah. They were the sons of the kingdom who were thrown into outer darkness (Matthew 8:12), and consigned to the second resurrection instead of partaking of the divine nature and being part of the kingdom of priests as intended for the first resurrection (2 Peter 1: 4). They were called to the kingdom but forfeited their call. (Matthew 22:13-14)
6. All hypocrites, those who knew to do good and did not do it but lived in a sinful manner, Y'shua calls "an evil servant", will be raised for judgement (Matthew 24:45-51). Also those who did not obey His Word - Matthew 7:19-27
7. The 'wicked', those entrenched in evil, will be judged at this time, including all those who opposed or completely rejected Yahweh and His Messiah in their lifetimes.
There will be many excluded from the first resurrection who refused to walk the 'narrow way'. Luke 13:23-30
If we would judge ourselves, we will not be judged, Yahweh subjects us to chastening to save us from being condemned with the world. 1 Corinthians 11:31-32 1 Peter 4:17
The lawless and disobedient will have their portion with the hypocrites and the unbelievers. Matthew 7:21-23
===THE MILLENIUM=== The Eternal Word of Yahweh God will take up His authority to execute judgment and establish the kingdom on earth. "And He Himself will rule them with a rod of iron"; "And with Him the armies of heaven, clothed in fine linen (righteous saints), white and clean, followed Him on white horses." - Revelation 19: 8; 19:14, 15; Isaiah 11: 4; 66:16
He will take His divine authority as King of Kings and He shall reign together with His saints who are raised in the first resurrection, and they will rule with Messiah for one thousand years.
Authority to execute judgment will be given to them to institute His divine government over the earth according to the measure of authority they each have been given, and they shall rule the nations with a 'rod of iron' to bring them under subjection to His principles, statutes and laws. Revelation 20:4; 2:26, 27
They will be empowered with the authority of His Word.
"Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? Do you not know that we shall judge angels?" 1 Corinthians 6: 2, 3
As well as executing authority over His kingdom, they shall be officiating "priests of God and of Messiah" on behalf of the people, according to His eternal purpose to have a "kingdom of priests", or "kings and priests". Revelation 20: 6; 1: 6; 5:10, also Exodus 19: 6 & Isaiah 32:1
"Who is that faithful and wise servant, whom his master will make ruler over his household, to give them their food in due season? Assuredly, I say to you, that he will make him ruler over all his goods." Matthew 24:45, 47
There is a role in this oversight in the kingdom to teach knowledge and instruct in the ways of Yahweh, to give them their appropriate 'food', i.e. to speak a word in season - to exhort, encourage and edify the 'nations' that they might learn to walk in the ways of the Lord..
Satan will be bound during this time period and mankind will be free of his influence on the earth, and yet there will still be those who do not repent from their sin, and who will after the allotted time, be accursed. Revelation 20: 1-3; Isaiah 65:20
Just as there will still be those who will rebel against Yahweh, even after they have seen demonstrated the true knowledge of Him in the earth, have experienced His goodness and benefited from His righteous government. The earth will become filled with the knowledge of Yahweh and the earth will experience its Sabbath rest.
"And it shall come to pass that from one New Moon to another, and from one Sabbath to another, all flesh shall come to worship before Me, saith Yahweh." Isaiah 66:23
===ISRAEL HIS SEAT OF GOVERNMENT=== There will be a restoration of the whole House of Israel back to the land in a miraculous exodus, although only a remnant of all those born as Israelites will be saved (Romans 9:27; Jeremiah 31:7-8 ), and together both Houses (born again 'Jews' and enlightened Ephraimites - Judah and Ephraim), will defeat their enemies and they will possess their possessions, their eternal inheritance in the land. Isaiah 11:10-16 & 12:1-6; Jeremiah 16:14; Obadiah 17-18
This will be the time of the fulfillment of His promises to the patriarchs and the past men of faith, who looked for that city whose builder and maker was Yahweh. From righteous Abel, Enoch, Noah and Abraham to whom the everlasting covenant promise was made, (which promise we have entered into) who lived as pilgrims in this world awaiting that which was to come (Hebrews 11:10, 13-16). Note - Not all of Israel entered into this covenant.
Abraham was also promised, all the land as far as his eye could see, (as well as being in the New Jerusalem) which he also did not receive in his lifetime even though it was established by an unconditional covenant. Genesis 13:14; 15:7-21; 17:8
Isaac and Jacob and many others were inheritors of these same promises, as well as those who qualify from this age. To this end Paul preached, "warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Messiah Y'shua" Colossians 1:28
"That your love may abound still more and more in knowledge and all discernment, that you may approve the things that are excellent, that [i.e. in order that] you may be sincere and without offence till the day of Messiah, .. .. being filled with all the fruits of righteousness which are by Y'shua the Messiah." Philippians 1: 9-11
We who are Abraham's seed are the Israel of Yahweh God. The new covenant was made to the Israel of God (Hebrews 8: 8, 10), and there are no racial or in-house distinctions. See Colossians 3:10-11; Galatians 3:26-29; Ephesians 2:12
He will establish His everlasting covenant with His people on the earth, with David as their king, as a prince, ruling from Jerusalem, and His tabernacle will be with them. 2 Samuel 23:5 & Ezekiel 37:21-28 From Chapter 40 through to 48, Ezekiel gives all the specifications for the establishment of the temple and the divisions of the land, and all that is to be set in order for the millennial reign of Messiah through His saints.
The time will have come that the saints possess the kingdom. Daniel 7:22 "Then the kingdom and dominion, and the greatness of the kingdoms under the whole heaven, shall be given to the saints of the Most High. His kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey Him." Daniel 7:27
This has been the expectation of Israel for the kingdom to come on earth, as Y'shua taught us to pray.
"Thy kingdom come, Your will be done upon earth as it is in heaven .. .." Luke 11: 1-4
"Will you at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?" - was the expectation of the disciples at that time. (Acts 1:6) Y'shua said to the twelve disciples that they would sit on thrones, when He took up the throne of His glory, and they would judge the twelve tribes of Israel. Matthew 19:28 & Luke 22:30; Psalm 122: 5
"In mercy the throne will be established, and One will sit on it in truth, in the tabernacle of David, judging and seeking justice and hastening righteousness." Isaiah 16: 5
The kingdom of His House shall be established and the law will go forth from Zion and establish justice and peace on the earth. When His judgments are in the earth. the people will learn righteousness. Isaiah 2: 1-4; 26: 9
All these things which are prophesied in the scriptures are to be fulfilled before Y'shua the Messiah returns to dwell with His people "whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God has spoken by the mouth of all His holy prophets since the world began." Acts 3:21 It is not until the New Jerusalem descends to earth that He comes to dwell with His people. Revelation 21: 3, 22-23; 22: 3-4
===THE SECOND RESURRECTION=== "But the rest of the dead did not live again until the thousand years were finished" Revelation 20: 5 Upon this scene of the established kingdom on earth, the dead of all ages are raised to life.
"Then I saw a great white throne and Him who sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away. And there was found no more place for them. And I saw the dead, small and great, standing before God, and the books were opened. And another book was opened, which is the Book of Life. And the dead were judged according to their works, by the things which were written in the books." Revelation 20:11-12
There are several books of records as well as the Book of life that will be opened. Daniel said, "I watched till thrones were put in place, and the Ancient of days was seated; ... "The court was seated, and the books were opened." Daniel 7: 9-10
Y'shua said, "There is nothing covered that shall not be revealed, and hidden that shall not be known." Matthew 10:26
and, "For every idle (unprofitable) word men shall speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment. For by your words you will be justified and by your words you will be condemned." Matthew 12:36-37
Even the counsels of the heart will be manifest (1 Corinthians 4:5; Romans 2:16), for it has all been recorded. The only things not recorded are those things which have been sincerely repented of and washed clean by the blood of the Lamb. 1 John 1: 8-10
This judgment takes place at the end of the present "heaven and earth". The present creation flees away from before Him and there is no longer any place for it. Revelation 20:11
After the judgment is completed, John is shown "a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away" Revelation 21: 1
Peter says, "The Day of the Lord comes as a thief in the night in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will melt with fervent heat, both the earth and the works in it shall be burnt up." 2 Peter 3:10
And the writer of Hebrews, "Yet once more I will shake not only the earth, but also heaven. Now this, "Yet once more," indicates the removal of those things that are being shaken, as of things that are made, that the things which cannot be shaken may remain." Hebrews 12:26b-27; Haggai 2: 6
Those not found written in the Book of Life are cast into the lake of fire. Y'shua warned that both soul and body could be destroyed in hell. (Greek here is 'gehenna', i.e. 'hell-fire' - not 'hades' i.e. 'the grave') Luke 12: 5; Revelation 20:14
Death and the grave will also cease to exist. "Death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death." Revelation 20:14
That blessed day will have arrived when "Death is swallowed up in victory" 1 Corinthians 15:54
With death being abolished, the restoration of all things has been completed, and the Son, having completed His work, restores the kingdom to the Father, that He, Yahweh God, may be "all in all". "Then comes the end, when He delivers the kingdom to God the Father, when He puts an end to all rule and all authority and power. For He must reign till He has put all enemies under His feet. The last enemy that will be destroyed is death.." "Now when all things are made subject to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that Yahweh may be all in all." 1 Corinthians 15:24-26, 28
Of that state of existence we only get small glimpses, of glory unimaginable to our natural minds for which every hardship, trial, suffering or sacrifice rendered in this life will be nothing compared to that sublime glory which will be revealed.
"But as it is written, Eye has not seen, nor ear heard, nor have entered into the heart of man the things which God has prepared for those who love Him." 1 Corinthians 2: 9 (quote from Isaiah 64:4)
"Behold the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. And God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes; there shall be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away. Then He who sat on the throne said, Behold I make all thing new." Revelation 21: 3-5
"Therefore, seeing all these things will be dissolved, what manner of persons ought you to be in holy conduct and godliness, looking for and hastening the day of God" 2 Peter 3:11
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: +category
revision.text:
===ETERNAL JUDGMENT=== The word "judge" - KRINOS means "to separate, to make a distinction between, to exercise judgement upon, to estimate, to assume a censorial power over, to call to account, to judge judiciously, to bring to trial, to be brought to account, to administer government over"
===THE REASON FOR JUDGMENT=== 1. Because of sin against His laws. "As many as have sinned [missed the mark] in the law, shall be judged by the law" (Romans 2:12) "The soul that sins shall die" (Ezekiel 18: 4; also Romans 3:23)
2. Because of disobedience - in that Yahweh is righteous and cannot overlook sin, the penalty for the broken law has to be met. Those who do not know Yahweh as well as those who do not obey the gospel incur His wrath. There are the two categories cited in 2 Thessalonians 1: 8; Romans 2: 8, 9
3. Because ungodliness and unrighteousness is unacceptable to His holiness, and sinners cannot come into His presence. Hebrews 7:26; 1 Peter 1:15,16; 1 Timothy 6:13-16; Revelation 15:4
4. His justice demands retribution upon those who have violated His commands, and exclusion from His presence and His future kingdom. 2 Thessalonians 1: 9; Revelation 21:27, 8
5. To limit the effects of individual and collective sin so that man may come to repentance and be saved from eternal destruction. When His judgments are embraced they work salvation Psalm 94:12-13; 2 Peter 3: 9
Y'shua the appointed judge had many things to say of the judgment to come. He gave many warnings and told many parables to the His people, of the righteous judgment to come, against all sin and disobedience. He spoke often of "gehenna" often translated as 'hell' or 'hell-fire' and the torment, anguish and punishment which would be inflicted there. He always categorised this punishment as "eternal' or "everlasting" as it is often translated in our English versions. These two words come from the Greek words AONIAN and AIDIOS which mean 'to the age' and 'age-lasting'. The same term is used for the recipients of "eternal" & "everlasting life".
'Eternal' life and 'eternal' punishment would have to be equated as the same length of time, or else of the same nature, being spoken of in the same way - i.e. that which is enduring.
Eternal judgment awaits every human soul. Y'shua our Messiah will return, the dead will be raised and they will be judged by Him and receive their eternal destiny. This will be a visible public and universal judgment. The Lamb's victory over sin, death and Satan will be fully manifested and executed.
===IDENTITY OF THE JUDGE=== The Father is the instigator of the judgment to bring to completion His plan for the ages by bringing an end to sin and lawlessness, and bringing in everlasting righteousness. See also Daniel 12: 2, 3 God the Father is cited as the judge of all - Hebrews 12:23; 1 Peter 4: 5
The Son has been given the authority to judge, because He is the Son of Man. John 5:27 "He has fixed a day when He will judge the world righteously by a Man who He has destined and appointed for that task" Romans 3: 6 Amplified Version - See also Acts 10:42
"For the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son, .." John 5:22
THE FINAL JUDGMENT "He that rejects Me, and doesn't receive My words has one that judges him: the WORD THAT I HAVE SPOKEN, the same shall judge him in the last day." John 12:48
If men refuse to accept God's judgment of sin at Calvary in Messiah, and refuse to judge themselves by that Word which is the only infallible standard, then there only remains the penalty for their sin, which is judgment to destruction. Eternal death is the consequence of sin upon unregenerate man.
If Yahweh did not spare His wrath upon His own Son Whom He made to be sin for us (in order to spare us), what will be the state of the willful, the lawless, and the rebellious? 1 Peter 4:17-18; John 3:36
For each person that departs this life there will be an expectation of a resurrection as well as an expectation of judgment. "It is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment" Hebrews 9:27
"We shall all stand before the judgment seat (throne) of Messiah. For it is written: As I live, says Yahweh, every knee shall bow to Me, and every tongue shall confess to God. So then each of us shall give account of himself to God" Romans 14:10-12; Isaiah 45:23
"And I saw a Great White Throne, and Him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them. "And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of Life: and the dead were judged according to their works, by the things that were written in the books" Revelation 20:11,12
The "books" are opened. In these are the records of all that each person has thought, said and done upon earth that has not been taken out and washed clean by the Blood of the Lamb. The "book of Life" is also opened, allowing us to understand that a search will be made through it for a record of the names of those standing before the throne on this occasion.
===THE OPENED BOOKS=== An earthly court of law proceeds upon evidence. The scriptures tell us that the heavenly court will be set for the proceedings to go forth, and all the evidence will be brought forth. The heavenly court will be seated and the books opened. Daniel 7:10
1. THE SCRIPTURES "The word that I have spoken will judge him in the last day" John 12:48 He is the eternal Word Who spoke to Moses and gave us the Law. We will be held accountable to have obeyed His revealed Word. Hebrews 2: 1-4
2 THE BOOK OF LIFE The entries in the Book of Life will be a major determining factor of eternal destinies. Luke 10:20; Phil. 4:3; Daniel 12:1 However Yahweh said to Moses that whoever had sinned against Him in idolatry would have his name blotted out. See Exodus 32:33 & Deuteronomy 9:14. Also the ungodly - Psalm 69:28
Also again emphasised, that whoever turned away and followed the gods of the world, his name would be blotted out of the Book of Life. Deuteronomy 29:14, 18-20
Those of Sardis who overcame the lusts of the flesh were guaranteed their names will not be blotted out. Revelation 3:5
3. THE BOOK OF REMEMBRANCE "Then they that feared Yahweh spoke often one to another and Yahweh listened and heard them; So a Book of Remembrance was written before Him for those who fear Yahweh and who meditate on His name." and the promise - "And they shall be Mine, says Yahweh Sabboath, On the day that I make them My jewels." (Malachi 3:16) Note Revelation 21:19, 20 - the gemstones of New Jerusalem
4. BOOK OF PRAYER/INTERCESSION The prayers of the righteous are recorded by the ministration of angels. "Put my tears into your bottle; are they not in Your book? When I cry out to You, Then my enemies will turn back .. " Psalm 56: 8, 9
"My face is flushed from weeping .... ..... and my prayer is pure. Surely even now my witness [record KJ] is in heaven, and my evidence is on high" Job 16:16-19
5. 'BOOK' OF STEWARDSHIP Accounting is made of each one's faithfulness in stewardship over the things entrusted to their care. Y'shua gave a parable of a nobleman going away and entrusting his servants to continue his business, with the instruction to "occupy till I come" (Luke 19:12-27)
He gave another parable where a steward was called to "Give account of your stewardship" Luke 16:2-13
6. RECORDS OF WORDS AND COUNSELS OF THE HEART The heart of man will be judged by the things he has said, "for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks" (Matthew 12:34, 36-37) An account will be required for every unprofitable, worthless word.
"For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known" Luke 12: 2
He will bring to light all the hidden, secret counsels of the heart, and every secret work. 1 Corinthians 4:5; Romans 2:16; Luke 8:17; Matthew 6: 4-6, 17-18
7. RECORDS OF ALL DEEDS Everything down to a cup of water that we give to one of His, (Matthew 10:41-42) and kind acts done to a child in His Name (Matthew 18: 5) are recorded. Consider, even the hairs of our head are numbered and not one sparrow falls to the ground but He knows. Psalm 139:16 Our Father has an excellent accounting system.
===THE JUDGMENT ACCORDING TO WORKS=== " ... ... the Father, who without partiality judges according to each one's work, conduct yourselves throughout the time of your stay here in fear; " 1 Peter 1:17; 4: 1-5, 17-18
"Fear God and keep His commandments, for this is the whole duty of man (man's all NKJ); For God will bring every work into judgment, including every secret thing, whether good or evil." Ecclesiastes 12:14 "For we must all appear before the judgment seat (throne) of Messiah, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad." 2 Corinthians 5:10
"eternal life to those who by patient continuance in doing good seek for glory, honor and immortality; but to those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness - indignation and wrath, tribulation and anguish, on every soul of man who does evil, of the Jew first and also of the Greek .. .. For there is no partiality with God." Romans 2:7-9, 11 (Note. Jew and Greek (nations) covers all believers - see verses 1-6 of same chapter)
FOR THAT REASON - the apostles of Messiah said, "Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Y'shua the Messiah" Colossians 1:28
" to present you holy, and blameless and above reproach in His sight" Colossians 1:22
" That you may be sincere and without offence till the day of Messiah, being filled with the fruits of righteousness " Philippians 1:10-11
"Who will confirm you to the end, that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord, Y'shua the Messiah." 1 Corinthians 1: 8
Y'shua said, "And that servant who knew his Master's will, and did not prepare himself or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes. But he who did not know, yet committed things deserving of stripes, shall be beaten with few. For everyone to whom much is given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been committed,of him they will ask the more." Luke 12:47-48
The measure of accountability will be according to the measure of knowledge of our Father's will, as also the measure of disciplinary punishment. Indicating that Y'shua is speaking here of corrective punishment for those who receive 'few stripes'. However, Y'shua says that for those who go into unrighteous living that He "will be cut him in two and appoint him his portion with the unbelievers" Luke 12:45-46
Vine's Expository Dictionary of N.T. Words says of the verb DICHOTOMEO that "some take the reference to be the mode of punishment by which criminals and captives were cut in two; others on account of the fact that in these passages the delinquent is still living after the treatment, take the verb to denote 'to cut up by scourging', 'to scourge severely', the word being used figuratively."
The Septuagint (the Greek translation of the Old Testament) uses this verb in relation to the severing of sacrificial animals (Genesis 15:10,17; Ex29:17; Lev.1:8; Ezek. 24:4).
In Matthew 24:51 Y'shua is quoted as applying it to hypocrites, and that to be cut in two is an appropriate punishment for one who has lived a double life. "There shall be weeping and wailing and gnashing of teeth" - great remorse is the resultant reaction of the one who is punished in this way.
That which is evident is that all who do not live the life, lose their inheritance in the kingdom of God along with the hypocrites and incur the same judgment as the unbelievers. With this the rest of scripture agrees.
"But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints; neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor coarse jesting, which are not fitting, but rather giving of thanks. For this you know, that no fornicator, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolator, has any inheritance in the kingdom of Messiah and God. Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience. Therefore do not be partakers with them." Ephesians 5: 3- 7
"Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are adultery, fornication (sexual relationship outside of marriage), uncleanness ( moral impurity), lewdness (lustfulness, wantonness, lasciviousness), idolatry (worship of things or people - identities & ideologies), sorcery (all involvement in occultic, psychic or witchcraft practices), hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions (divisions), heresies (doctrine contrary to foundational principles), envy (coveting), murders, drunkenness, revelries and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I told you in times past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God." Galatians 5:19-21
"Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. (Lit. 'led astray') Neither fornicators, nor idolators, nor adulterers, nor homosexuals (sexual abusers), nor sodomites, nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God." 1 Corinthians 6: 9-10
"For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift (salvation), and have become partakers of the Ruach HaKodesh (Holy Spirit) and have tasted the good Word of Yahweh and the powers of the world to come, if they fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of Yahweh (Messiah), and put Him to an open shame." Hebrews 6: 4-6
The warnings are there to caution us and to guard us from being overcome by the deceptions of the enemy. "But beloved, we are confident of better things concerning you, yes things that concern salvation, though we speak in this manner." Hebrews 6: 9
Judgment upon all sin is certain, "But let us who are of the day be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet the hope of salvation. For God did not appoint us to wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Y'shua the Messiah." 1 Thessalonians 5: 8, 9
"Wherefore are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises, that through these you might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust." 2 Peter 1: 4
"Be diligent to be found in Him in peace, without spot and blameless." 2 Peter 3:14
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Thanks.
revision.text: Thanks to you i find what i need to learn Japanese. You don't know how much i have looked to learn it, thanks men.

revision.comment: +category
revision.text:
===THE JUDGEMENT SEAT=== The word BEMA which is used for the Judgement Throne of Messiah at the end of the age, comes from a root word 'to step'. It means literally 'foot-room', and was used for a raised platform that was reached by steps. The word became used for a tribune in the law courts of Greece, one for a defendant and the other for the accuser. This word was applied to the tribunal of a Roman magistrate or ruler and this was its usage at the time of Paul. It is used here for the divine tribunal before which all mankind are to hereafter stand. (Vine's N. T. Expository Dictionary)
In the parables, Y'shua speaks of the angels going forth and first removing the wicked, together with all who offend and practice lawlessness. Then the righteous which are left shall shine forth in the kingdom. Matthew 13:43, 49; Daniel 12:2, 3
===THE JUDGMENT ACCORDING TO REPONSIBILITY=== The heaviest judgment comes upon those with the greatest responsibility. The judgment is made according to the measure of light given, and he who stood in the presence of the Almighty Himself as the "anointed cherub" will incur the greatest punishment, together with those of the angels who defected with him.
====THE JUDGMENT OF SATAN AND THOSE WHO WORSHIP HIM==== 1. Satan, the adversary, and his angels are "cast into the lake of fire and brimstone where the beast and the false prophet are and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever." Revelation 20:10
2. The False Prophet and the Beast also will be "cast alive into the lake of fire burning with brimstone" Revelation 19:20
3. Together with them will be all those who received the Mark of the Beast, for them there is no forgiveness, for they will have become completely possessed so as to be completely taken over by Satan. This will be a more pervasive form of possession than any human has before this experienced, and it will involve complete responsibility in worshiping Satan. In worshiping the AntiMessiah (the Beast), they will have entered into the most blasphemous union possible against God.
"If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand, he himself shall also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out in full strength into the cup of His indignation. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb. And the smoke of their torment ascends up for ever and ever; and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and who receives the mark of his name." Revelation 14:9-11
=====ASSESSMENT OF THEIR SENTENCE===== Their judgment is to be 'tormented' and that 'forever and ever'. This condition of being in torment is stated literally in the Greek as being "to the ages of the ages". And more intensity is decreed on those humans who take the Mark, His wrath is poured out "in full strength" and "they have no rest day or night". No respite is given them from the torment of the lake of fire.
====THE JUDGMENT OF THE WICKED==== Confirmed Unbelievers, Hypocrites and Backsliders 1. '''Unbelievers''' This category of unbelievers is those who have refused the knowledge of Yahweh in that they, by choice, do not wish to retain Him in their consciousness, but rather love unrighteousness and they have utterly rejected Him. Their hearts are manifest by their fruit. Matthew 7:15-20
"Do you not know this from of old, since man was placed on earth, that the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite is but for a moment? " The heavens will reveal his iniquity, and the earth will rise up against him. The increase of his house will depart, and his goods will flow away in the Day of His wrath. This is the portion from God for a wicked man, the heritage appointed for him by God" Job 20:4-5; 27-29
"The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God." Psalm 9:17
For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who suppress the truth in unrighteousness" Romans 1:18
2. '''Hypocrites''' Y'shua said, "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut up the kingdom of heaven against men; for you neither go in yourselves, nor do you allow those who are entering to go in."
"Therefore you will receive the greater condemnation." Matthew 23:13, 14b Hypocrites bear the responsibility of all those that they lead astray through the false image they have presented.
"How can you escape the condemnation of hell?" Matthew 23:33 Because, knowing the truth, they have lived a lie, and are held accountable for the truth they knew but did not do, because their heart was evil.
3. '''Backsliders''' Y"shua had the most to say in warning people against falling away into unrighteous living, as also did the apostles. For if we have fully known the truth, and turn away, we make void the gift of eternal life.
"For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and have become partakers of the Holy Spirit, and have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the age to come, if they fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God, and put Him to an open shame." Hebrews 6: 4-6
and again, "For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins, but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and fiery indignation which will devour the adversaries. "For we know Him Who said, 'Vengeance is Mine, says Yahweh'. And again, 'Yahweh will judge His people'. It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God." Hebrews 10:26-27; 30-31 from Deuteronomy 32:35-36
Y'shua spoke the parable of the tares in regard to the wicked who would be severed from among the righteous at the end of the age . This included all those who cause offenses and those who practice lawlessness (those insubordinate to His laws) "the tares are the sons of the wicked" Matt.13:28, 38 "the harvest is the end of the age" (verse 39) "as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so will it be at the end of the age" (verse 40) "The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who practice lawlessness, and will cast them into a furnace of fire. There will be weeping and wailing and gnashing of teeth." Matthew 13:41-42
Note those included in this category of judgment - "the wicked" Matthew 13:49-50
"those causing offenses" Matthew 18: 6-9 "wrong done to the brethren" Matthew 25:31-46 & 1 Corinthians 3:17 "evil servant" - backslider Matthew 24:48-51 & 1 Corinthians 6: 9-10 "false prophets" Matthew 7:15-20 "false teachers & "hypocrites" Matthew 23:13-14,33 & 2 Peter 2: 1, 3 "the unrighteous" Luke 12:45-46 & Romans 2: 8 "the lawless & insubordinate" Luke 19:14-27 & 2 Peter 2: 9
=====ASSESSMENT OF THEIR SENTENCE===== The scriptures speak of the judgment of hell-fire (Gehenna) as being destruction, perishing, and complete physical, spiritual and eternal ruin. ("Fear Him who has power to destroy both body and soul in hell" [Gehenna]) Matthew 10:48
"The destruction of transgressors and of sinners shall be together and those who forsake Yahweh shall be consumed (KALAH) " Isaiah 1:28 (The verb here has the sense of 'to end' or to 'be finished'.)
Note the three categories - confirmed sinners, transgressors and those who forsake Him after knowing Him. For this, they have prepared themselves, they are "the vessels of wrath who have fitted themselves for destruction" Romans 9:22 (literal translation)
Notice the statement - "weeping and wailing and gnashing of teeth" (Matt.13:42) - great remorse and anguish at their fate.
This awesome fire that will consume and annihilate the wicked is called the "second death" (Rev. 20:14; Rev. 21:8). It is the final death from which there is no resurrection! This death is the penalty of sin (Rom. 6:23). It is the death Y'shua the Messiah came to spare all of us from! As Malachi wrote: "For, behold, the day cometh, that shall burn as an oven; and all the proud, and all that do wickedly, shall be stubble: .. And you shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I do this, says Yahweh of hosts" Malachi 4: 1, 3.
====THE JUDGMENT OF THE NATIONS==== "For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature those things contained in the law, these, although not having the law, are a law to themselves; which shew forth the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and between themselves their thoughts accusing or else excusing them in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Y'shua the Messiah. . ." Romans 2:14-16
This will be a time of judgment for the nations (the Gentiles who did not know the truth of salvation in Messiah)-- but not necessarily a time of total condemnation, depending of their individual works, whether they were good or evil.
"When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory. All the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them one from another, as a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats." Matthew 25:31
The dividing factor will be as to how they received His people, based on the principle which He taught His disciples that "He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me." Matthew 10:40
These are people who had not come into the new covenant, but will be judged according to their actions toward His people, and if they are "goats", they will incur judgment. Matthew 10:11-15; 25:45-46
Y'shua said of this time of judgment, "The men of Nineveh will rise up in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and, behold, a greater than Jonah is here. The queen of the south [queen of Sheba] shall rise up in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here" Matthew 13:41-42 & Luke 11:31-32
In another place, "Then He began to upbraid the cities wherein most of His mighty works were done, because they repented not: Woe unto you, Chorazin! woe unto you, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes. But I say unto you, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the Day of judgment, than for you.
"And you, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shall be brought down to Gehenna: for if the mighty works, which have been done in you, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day. But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for you" Matthew 11:20-24
